Class LoggerStdOutErrHandler

java.lang.Object
java.util.logging.Handler
cz.cvut.copakond.sweetfluffysheep.model.utils.logging.LoggerStdOutErrHandler
public class LoggerStdOutErrHandler extends Handler
LoggerConfig is a utility class that configures the logging settings for the application. It allows enabling or disabling logging based on the provided boolean parameter. Documentation

  • Constructor Details

    • LoggerStdOutErrHandler

      public LoggerStdOutErrHandler()
      Constructor for LoggerStdOutErrHandler. Initializes the stdout and stderr handlers with simple formatting.

  • Method Details

    • publish

      public void publish(LogRecord record)
      Decides where to publish the log record based on its level. (stderr for WARNING and above, stdout for lower levels)
      Specified by:
      publish in class Handler
      Parameters:
      record - description of the log event. A null record is silently ignored and is not published

    • flush

      public void flush()
      Flushes the output streams for both stdout and stderr handlers. Ensures that any buffered log records are written to their respective streams.
      Specified by:
      flush in class Handler

    • close

      public void close() throws SecurityException
      Closes the stdout and stderr handlers. Releases any resources associated with the handlers.
      Specified by:
      close in class Handler
      Throws:
      SecurityException - if a security manager exists and denies the close operation.
